title: 27-year-old Taunton man to face animal cruelty charge over underfed dog
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime The dog, a severely malnourished puppy named Sprout, was discovered during a routine traffic stop.
Sprout arrived “severely emaciated" and required a blood transfusion and hospitalization, according to the Animal Protection Center of Southeastern Massachusetts.

Animal Protection Center of Southeastern Massachusetts By Abby Patkin December 5, 2025 | 3:38 PM 2 minutes to read Police in West Bridgewater are looking to charge a 27-year-old man with animal cruelty after an officer discovered a severely malnourished dog in his car during a routine traffic stop.

title: 5 things to know about new Red Sox pitcher Johan Oviedo

bullets: Boston Red Sox Oviedo recently returned from a pair of major injuries, but projects to be a part of the Red Sox' starting rotation.
Johan Oviedo was acquired by the Red Sox on Thursday.

title: Teen girl seriously injured by vehicle during tree lighting celebration in Salisbury
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The crash occurred in Salisbury Square as residents gathered to ring in the holiday season.
A teenage girl was hit by a car and seriously injured Thursday in Salisbury as the town celebrated its annual Christmas tree lighting.
Police responded to a crash involving a pedestrian just before 5:30 p.

title: Celtics F Josh Minott calls out NBA refereeing this season
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "Y’all really got to understand the stuff I’ve got to fight through being not a brand name player in this league.
" Josh Minott after hitting a three against the Knicks (Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff).
NBA players and fans have spoken for years about their belief that star players get a better whistle from refs than role players.

title: Final cost figures released for Wu’s Canada trip
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Mayor Michelle Wu spent three days in Nova Scotia, using more than $11,000 in taxpayer dollars to cover travel expenses for herself, staff, and police.
Boston Mayor Michelle Wu is outfitted with safety equipment before assisting with cutting the white spruce tree that was selected as Nova Scotia's 2025 Tree for Boston.
Darren Calabrese /The Canadian Press via AP ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: The next phase of FIFA’s World Cup ticket availability begins soon. Here’s how to sign up.
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: World Cup The third phase of FIFA World Cup ticket sales will be the first to happen following Friday's "Final Draw," meaning that fans will largely know which teams are set to play in the group stage games.
The FIFA World Cup 2026 Countdown Clock next to Faneuil Hall in Boston in June.

Pat Greenhouse/ The Boston Globe Staff By Hayden Bird December 5, 2025 | 1:05 PM 2 minutes to read The latest step in the buildup to the FIFA 2026 World Cup — Friday’s “Final Draw” — is set to determine the all-important match-ups and pathways that nations will navigate when the competition itself kicks off in June, 2026.
